channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: State of ceasefire talks between Russia-Ukraine and Israel-Hamas
item.description: The U.S. is holding talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin in hopes of ending the war in Ukraine. Ukraine has already accepted the terms for a 30...

item.title: Extreme weather expected Saturday gets rarely used ‘high risk’ designation
item.description: A dynamic storm system threatening to spawn powerful tornadoes and hail as big as baseballs has earned a relatively rare designation from forecasters.

item.title: Man last known to be seen with missing University of Pittsburgh student tells prosecutors how he rescued her from rough water
More than 50 universities face federal investigations as part of Trump’s anti-DEI campaign
Trump, addressing DOJ attorneys, says that those who fight him in court are 'scum'
item.description: President Trump made a rare visit to DOJ headquarters Friday, where he addressed many of the lawyers tasked with defending his policies across more th...

item.title: Trump says he was being a 'bit sarcastic' when he promised to end Russia-Ukraine war in 24 hours
Appeals court rules Trump can implement anti-DEI executive orders for now
item.description: The decision from the three-judge panel allows the orders to be enforced as a lawsuit challenging them plays out.

item.title: Trump administration weighs travel ban on dozens of countries, memo says
Rubio says the U.S. will revoke more student visas
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced that the U.S. will revoke more student visas in the coming days. At a G-7 meeting in Canada Friday, Rubio acc...

item.title: White House allegedly asked for updates on arrest of Mahmoud Khalil: Attorney

item.title: 3 claims about the Department of Education and what it really does
item.description: President Donald Trump and his allies continue to make false claims about education in the country.

item.title: After Columbia arrests, international college students fall silent
Leader of ISIS in Iraq and Syria killed, Pentagon says
item.description: On his Truth Social platform Friday night, President Trump wrote that "the fugitive leader of ISIS in Iraq was killed."

item.title: CENTCOM forces kill ISIS' chief of global operations in precision airstrike
item.description: A U.S. airstrike in western Iraq on Thursday killed the ISIS’ chief of global operations who also served as ISIS’ second in command, known as “Abu Kha...

item.title: Scientists issue urgent warning about mysterious 'cold blob' in the ocean: 'Most likely underestimated'
With Democrats' help, Senate votes to avert a government shutdown
item.description: The Senate passed a House-approved government funding bill that averts a government shutdown that was set to be triggered at the end of the day Friday...

item.title: State senator and longtime trucker on potential Alaska-bound toll

item.title: Rubio says South Africa’s ambassador to the US 'is no longer welcome' in the country
